intro: Jacquemontia obcordata, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, oval leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its flowers are typically pink or red, blooming in late spring to early summer. Jacquemontia obcordata is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in woodland edges. It is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
